candidates.name: Claire Vogtherr
candidates.why_elect: While I have been in business for many years running Holly Bacon, I am at heart a nurse who trained in Hawkes Bay. I have governance experience so understand the responsibilities of this role and have the passion to robustly debate issues. A business head with a nurse's heart.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate Hawke's Bay. I want our residents to enjoy the best health and healthcare possible within the DHB budget while promoting community wellness programmes that ensure a healthier and more motivated school role, workforce and retired Hawke's Bay wide population. This will reduce admissions and improve general health.

candidates.name: James Crow
candidates.why_elect: I have 16 years of successful business experience. I bring strong governance and perspective to the role, sitting on both a company and charitable trust board. I will represent our community's voices while also ensuring the sustainability and economic balance of our DHB, and Te Tiriti O Waitangi commitments.
candidates.why_stand: As our community ages and our population of young families grows, we need systems in place to manage these diverse needs. I believe in developing a supportive and compassionate health system for our communities. To achieve this, we need all voices being heard, and board members to represent these views.

candidates.name: Jason Whaitiri
candidates.why_elect: I'm able to work alongside people with different backgrounds, voice concerns that need to be raised, be accountable for my decision's and able to manage matters that arise. I'm also not afraid to ask people working in the Health and Disability sector for guidance and solutions.
candidates.why_stand: I believe the DHB needs to reflect it's diverse communities to make better decisions that benefit all people whether you're under the Health and Disability Care, Primary/Secondary Care and Non-Profit Organisations. With the diversity across the DHB, I can see the benefits for the wider community.

candidates.name: David Davidson
candidates.why_elect: My governance experience includes local and national professional bodies, and previous terms on the board. I have also been active in service and recreational organisations. New technologies have immense benefits, but also risk reducing individual to statistics. We must ensure that the patient and family are our focus.
candidates.why_stand: I became the pioneer O&G specialist in HB and later a palliative care doctor. I have practiced in Palmerston North, Auckland, UK and Australia. My recent personal and family disabilities have highlighted the need for an experienced board advocate for the aged and infirm. I shall encourage a wrap-around service.

candidates.name: Julia Wilson
candidates.why_elect: I am a pharmacist and have an online business at www.discreetdelicates.shop that sells light bladder leakage underwear. I am passionate about preventative healthcare, and quality services for our ageing population. I was recently a volunteer member of the DHB Rheumatic Fever governance group.
candidates.why_stand: To ensure that Hawkes Bay has a high quality health system for our ageing population, that is also sustainable for future generations.

candidates.name: Peter Dunkerley
candidates.why_elect: I have been part of the delivery of a dependable, quality health service in Hawke's Bay for most of my career. I know and understand the patients and the health professionals. There are always difficult challenges. We have always got there with the resource available.
candidates.why_stand: Managing our health budget in Hawke's Bay needs a board with a complete understanding of the problems and challenges, and experience in managing the available and realistic solutions.

candidates.name: Trish Giddens
candidates.why_elect: I have worked 27 in hospital and health services.  My management experience is of 10 in health, 10 in social services and two in education. My governance is 20+ years—12 of these is local government, latterly as Mayor. I enjoy stakeholder and community engagement and working collaboratively.
candidates.why_stand: We have a great district and a growing population however people are having difficulty accessing health services. I've lived in CHB most of my life and enjoyed working and serving for the betterment of people and the community. Reflecting back 10 years and the current status of health—it's timely!

candidates.name: Leona Karauria
candidates.why_elect: I was born in Wairoa and i've seen a lot of struggling and challenges. My commitments have always been about the greater good for families and communities. Our many successes in community and technology mahi can be measured across the many communities across Aotearoa.
candidates.why_stand: The older I get, my health becomes more important and every time I lose a loved one, then life becomes that extra bit special. I want healthy families living in healthy communities.

candidates.name: Rizwaana (Riz) Latiff
candidates.why_elect: I started with the DHB, as an employee and branching into various other roles, which have included governance, project management and having an access agreement in the role of an LMC midwife. With 30 years experience I know how decisions made at board level can affect frontline staff.
candidates.why_stand: I have been involved with the Hawkes Bay DHB for many years and I believe that there needs to be a change how things are done. There needs to be a different approach and a more diverse range of members that are making decisions that affect a wide demography.

candidates.name: Graeme Norton
candidates.why_elect: I look for common ground on which to build trust and successful collaboration; respect and allow for differences of viewpoint, balancing that with the need to reach a decision; resolve issues and avoid being trapped by history; build better relationships with stakeholders; get difficult and complex stuff done.
candidates.why_stand: I firmly believe that we need to achieve equity in health for Māori as a priority. To do that we need to have concerted, collaborative action. A major reason I am standing is to bring my skills to the table to address these inequities which are unacceptable and avoidable.

candidates.name: Hayley Anderson
candidates.why_elect: I have real experience, in frontline nursing, and hospital operational and executive leadership. I have been CEO in primary care and GM in the disability sector. I have consulted to DHBs, Private Hospitals and Hospices. I was board member Hawkes Bay PHO and Chair Cranford Hospice Board.
candidates.why_stand: We live in a fabulous part of NZ but for many it can be difficult to enjoy what our region offers due to poor health. Everyone in HB should have good health yet we know the most vulnerable and Māori and Pasifika don't. I want to contribute to governance solutions.

candidates.name: Umang Patel
candidates.why_elect: I have been a Doctor on the front line for 15 years in NZ listening to patients across primary, secondary and rural interfaces and have seen directly the issues patients face. We must have a "health first" strategy and real clinical experience on the Board to achieve change.
candidates.why_stand: I want to improve the health and well being of all people in Hawkes Bay and reduce inequalities in health. I am motivated by the fact that we aren't delivering the patient oriented outcomes that matter the most. The ambulance at the bottom of the cliff approach is not working.

candidates.name: Ana Apatu
candidates.why_elect: My long-standing passion for health, along with my Bachelor of Nursing and Postgraduate Diploma in Public Health have led me to hold senior and national roles while retaining my focus on working with communities "at the grassroots" with programmes such as healthy eating. I am a champion for promoting wellness.
candidates.why_stand: Hawke's Bay deserves a health system where people are active partners in managing their own treatment and care. Communities must be supported to drive their own solutions, ensuring health resources reach those that need it the most and, in a way, that best works for people.

candidates.name: Paul Bebbington
candidates.why_elect: I believe my commercial background would add value to the Hawkes Bay District Health Board bringing new ideas and strong board governance. I hold Post Graduate qualifications in Business Management, Finance and Corporate Management along with a background in board level strategy in major international companies and government.
candidates.why_stand: As a survivor of Cancer I know the frustration and grief patients and their families go through due to inadequate services and lack of timely treatment. I will do my best at Board level to ensure that people have adequate and timely access to first rate cancer treatment.

candidates.name: John Smith
candidates.why_elect: Substantial submissions since 2011 on health related topics. Raw milk to then Food Safety Authority Health Select Committee on handing authority to fluoridate municipal water supplies to DHBs and Mental Health Inquiry. Accessible on my website knowledgewagon.nz Personally LCHF since 2002 living/loving the results.
candidates.why_stand: After 9 years since the Allan Smith story on 60 Minutes TV3 it was reasonable to expect DHBs to adopt IVC as common therapeutic practice. Beyond time it happened. I will be an advocate.

candidates.name: Garry Brian
candidates.why_elect: As a medical practitioner and eye surgeon, I have worked in NZ, Australia and many Asia-Pacific developing countries. I have held positions in international development organizations, including as Medical Director of the Fred Hollows Foundation in both NZ and Australia. I have experience and insight into community and hospital healthcare.
candidates.why_stand: I am not a single- or limited-issue candidate. My motivation is to see that best possible health outcomes are extracted from limited resources. If this is to be achieved, oversight of our health services by HBDHB must be evidence-based and dispassionate (but not uncaring). I will bring this to HBDHB.

candidates.name: Annette Brosnan
candidates.why_elect: I was raised and am now raising my family in Hawke's-Bay, I am extremely passionate about our-representation. I believe my assertive, well-researched and common scene contributions make a positive difference. I've also worked in Local-Government for 11 years and as a City Councillor, I also hold a Bachelor of Business Studies.
candidates.why_stand: I am running to represent us around the DHB table because there is work to be done, our struggle with resources, series of situations for improvement and poor health outcomes all need work. I love Hawke's Bay and believe I can make a difference for us.
